page.title: 15Staploe, Three Hamlets Club
page.content: Among numerous Evergreens and Darby and Jones, Staploe can claim a completely unique name for its over 60's Club "The Three Hamlets Club". Started in 1970, the club, with a membership of 40 to 50 holds monthly meetings on a Saturday, in the village hall. Additional events, visiting other clubs,Church services, day outings and the annual bike ride take place on week days. Completely self financing, the club raises funds from the tea money, raffles, Bingo and the big annual Harvest Sale, when gardens are stripped, preserves and cakes made, jumble and books collected and a town club invited to buy cheap country produce. Each New Year a party celebrates the "Hamlets" birthday, with an iced cake, sherry and sometimes a "home-grown" panto. Each summer a Garden Party is held.
